Entries.default: This fleshy column of fungus pulses faintly with bioluminescence. It smells moist.
A muted scream echoes somewhere far below.
The whisper of voices flits up from the depths.
You sense essence flowing lethargically to and from it. Perhaps this serves as a hub for the spores infesting the Archives.
You hack and poke at it, your weapons slamming uselessly into fungus and coming away clean.
The fungus thickens before your eyes.
A rippling wail of agony and mourning spreads through the Archives, echoing at the edges of your perception.
Gradually the light at the thickest strand of the column begins to dim, the fading colorlessness spreading outward, upward, and downward through the stalk.
Serafen winces. "Hear that, cap? Or were it in my head?"
Ydwin frowns. "I can feel it dying. It sounds like screaming."
The fungus shivers at your blow. Possibly in pleasure.
It sounds a bit like hitting a bass drum.
You hack and poke at it, your weapons slamming uselessly into fungus and coming away clean.
